page.title: 12Fishing in St. Levan. (2)
page.content: Mackerel, pickled in vinegar all the previous winter, are used to bait crab pots. They are roped together in 'strings' of six or seven and dropped with enough rope between them so that only one pot is lifted at a time. Each string is buoyed and flagged to show its location and owner. A winch is used to 'pull' the pots from the sea-bed. Conger eels are sometimes found in the pots. A special metal hook is used to get the conger eels out of the pots. Usually the congers are not sold but are chopped up for bait. The crab pots are left at sea all the time in the summer. They are brought in during winter because of bad weather. Several trips to sea are needed get in all the pots of one fisherman. The information on pages 11 & 12 was supplied by Mr. Leslie Trewern, who fishes from Porthgwarra.
